text: Joel Rueben Hitt Jr. (December 30, 1916 – June 2, 2003) was an American professional basketball and football player. He played in the National Basketball League for the Akron Goodyear Wingfoots during the 1939–40 season and averaged 0.7 points per game. In football, he was selected in the 1939 NFL Draft by the Cleveland Rams (13th round, 113th overall).
